p: Results indicated that all treatments induce high significant differences ( p < 0.001) when compared to control. Contrasting to the cell proliferation assays, significant differences were observed between A. arborescens and A. vera extracts ( p < 0.05). While A. arborescens exhibited a wound closure of 19%, A. vera was less effective in inhibiting cell invasiveness, with 37% of wound closure, which was significantly higher than deoxycycline. Under these conditions, A. arborescens yielded a cell viability of 45% and A. vera of 35% (data not shown).
